outcome.title: Surfaces and Graphs
outcome.description: Use traces and contours to describe the graphs of functions of two variables.

outcome.title: Vector Arithmetic
outcome.description: Compute and geometrically interpret sums, differences, scalar multiples, and magnitudes of vectors in n-dimensional space.

outcome.title: Vector Geometry
outcome.description: Use dot products and cross products of vectors to compute quantities of geometric interest, including projections, angles, and areas.

outcome.title: Parametrized Lines
outcome.description: Determine parametric equations for a line in three-space.

outcome.title: Planes
outcome.description: Find an equation for a plane in three-space defined either by three non-collinear points or by a point and a normal vector.

outcome.title: Intersections
outcome.description: Find the intersection of lines and planes.

outcome.title: Parameterized Curve
outcome.description: Sketch and parameterize portions of oriented curves, including those defined by intersections of surfaces and those which involve circular motions.

outcome.title: Derivatives and Curvature
outcome.description: Use derivatives to determine, and distinguish among, a parameterized curve’s tangent, speed, velocity, and acceleration.

outcome.title: Partial Derivatives
outcome.description: Compute the partial derivatives of a given multivariable function up to second order.

outcome.title: Tangent Planes
outcome.description: Find equations for tangent planes to surfaces expressed as graphs of two-variable functions and as level sets of three-variable functions.

outcome.title: Gradients
outcome.description: Compute the gradient vector of a two-variable function, give its geometric interpretation with respect both to the contours of the function and to its graph, and use it to calculate directional derivatives in a given direction.

outcome.title: Critical Points of Multivariable Functions
outcome.description: Use gradient vectors to locate critical points of a multivariable function, and second-order partial derivatives to classify critical points as local maximum, local minimum, saddle point, or degenerate.

outcome.title: Multivariable Limits
outcome.description: Use algebra, continuity, and polar-coordinate methods to calculate limits of multivariable functions, and use multiple-approach methods to demonstrate when such a limit does not exist.

outcome.title: Multivariable Chain Rule
outcome.description: Identify all routes of composition when two or more multivariable functions are composed, and use the multivariable chain rule to compute partial derivatives.

outcome.title: Higher Dimensional Gradients
outcome.description: Compute the gradient vector of a three-variable function, give its geometric interpretation with respect to its level surfaces, and use it to calculate directional derivatives in a given direction.

outcome.title: Multivariable Extreme Values
outcome.description: Use both critical points and a parametrization of its boundary to find absolute maximum and minimum values of a multivariable function on a closed and bounded domain.

outcome.title: Constrained Optimization
outcome.description: Use Lagrange multipliers to determine absolute maximum and minimum values of a multivariable function subject to one or more constant constraints.

outcome.title: Planar Regions
outcome.description: Describe a given region in the plane using coordinate inequalities in at least two distinct ways.

outcome.title: Double Integrals
outcome.description: Set up and evaluate double integrals over general regions, using iterated integrals with "tape-measured" bounds.

outcome.title: Integrals in Polar Coordinates
outcome.description: Use polar coordinates to transform the integrand, the bounds, and the area element of a given double integral.

outcome.title: Surface Area
outcome.description: Set up double integrals to compute surface areas of portions of parametrized surfaces.

outcome.title: Triple Integrals
outcome.description: Set up and evaluate triple integrals over general regions using iterated integrals and “tape-measured” bounds.

outcome.title: Integrals in Cylindrical and Spherical Coordinates
outcome.description: Use cylindrical and spherical coordinates to transform the integrand, the bounds, and the volume element of a given triple integral.

outcome.title: Change of Variables
outcome.description: Use change of variables simplify a multiple integral.

outcome.title: Vector Fields
outcome.description: Sketch and identify vector fields in two and three dimensions, including gradient vector fields of two- and three-variable functions.

outcome.title: Line Integrals
outcome.description: Directly compute the line integral of a vector field over a given oriented path.

outcome.title: Fundamental Theorem for Line Integrals
outcome.description: Determine if vector fields are gradients, find scalar potential functions for gradient fields, and apply the fundamental theorem of calculus for line integrals.

outcome.title: Green's Theorem
outcome.description: Use Green's Theorem to relate the total circulation of a vector field along a closed path to a double integral.

outcome.title: Curl of a Vector Field
outcome.description: Compute the scalar curl of a two-dimensional vector field, compute the vector curl of a three-dimensional vector field, and use notions of circulation to predict whether the scalar curl of a two-dimensional vector field is positive, negative, or zero.

outcome.title: Divergence of a Vector Field
outcome.description: Compute the divergence of a vector field and use notions of flux to predict whether the divergence of a given vector field is positive, negative, or zero.

outcome.title: Flux Integrals
outcome.description: Directly compute the flux integral of a vector field through a given oriented surface.

outcome.title: Stokes' and Divergence Theorem
outcome.description: Use Stokes’ Theorem (resp. Divergence Theorem) to relate a flux integral with a line integral (resp. triple integral).

outcome.title: Sample Outcome
outcome.description: Simplify the sum of two monomials.

outcome.title: Sample Image Outcome
outcome.description: Example of generating graphics.
